1.verse: Greeting - From Paul, who is a prisoner for Christ Jesus, and our brother Timothy. To our dear coworker Philemon,

2.verse: our sister Apphia, our fellow soldier Archippus, and the church that meets in your house.

3.verse: Good will  and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ are yours!

4.verse: Paul’s Prayer for Philemon - ⌞Philemon,⌟ I always thank my God when I mention you in my prayers because

5.verse: I hear about your faithfulness to the Lord Jesus and your love for all of God’s people.

6.verse: As you share the faith you have in common with others, I pray that you may come to have a complete knowledge of every blessing we have in Christ.

7.verse: Your love ⌞for God’s people⌟ gives me a lot of joy and encouragement. You, brother, have comforted God’s people.

8.verse: Paul’s Advice about Onesimus - Christ makes me bold enough to order you to do the right thing.

9.verse: However, I would prefer to make an appeal on the basis of love. I, Paul, as an old man and now a prisoner for Christ Jesus,

10.verse: appeal to you for my child Onesimus [Useful]. I became his spiritual father here in prison.

11.verse: Once he was useless to you, but now he is very useful to both of us.

12.verse: I am sending him back to you. This is like sending you a part of myself.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him here with me. Then he could have served me in your place while I am in prison for spreading the Good News.

14.verse: Yet, I didn’t want to do anything without your consent. I want you to do this favor for me out of your own free will without feeling forced to do it.

15.verse: Maybe Onesimus was gone for a while so that you could have him back forever—

16.verse: no longer as a slave but better than a slave—as a dear brother. He is especially dear to me, but even more so to you, both as a person and as a Christian.

17.verse: If you think of me as your partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.

18.verse: If he wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to me.

19.verse: I, Paul, promise to pay it back. I’m writing this with my own hand. I won’t even mention that you owe me your life.

20.verse: So, because we’re brothers in the Lord, do something for me. Give me some comfort because of Christ.

21.verse: I am confident as I write to you that you will do this. And I know that you will do even more than I ask.

22.verse: One more thing—have a guest room ready for me. I hope that, because of your prayers, God will give me back to you.

23.verse: Greetings from Paul’s Coworkers - Epaphras, who is a prisoner because of Christ Jesus like I am,

24.verse: and my coworkers Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke send you greetings.

25.verse: The good will of our Lord Jesus Christ be yours.
